{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about radio density, which is related to radiography. Document [6] discusses how radio density can be affected. It mentions that as the energy of the stream of electrons in the X-ray tube increases, the X-ray photons created from those electrons are more likely to penetrate the cells of the body and reach the image receptor, resulting in increased film density. The energy is proportional to the peak voltage (kVp), so decreasing kVp would decrease the energy and thus decrease the radio density.", "answer_choice": "B"}
